meanings.definition: A fall in which one lands on the buttocks.
meanings.sent1: During the play, the actor's pratfall made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: She slipped on a banana peel and took a pratfall in the comedy show.
meanings.sent3: The pratfall in the movie was unexpected but hilarious.
meanings.sent4: His pratfall on the ice was like a graceful dance move gone wrong.
meanings.sent5: The clown's pratfall was so exaggerated, it became the highlight of the show.

meanings.sent1: His public pratfall during the presentation was embarrassing.
meanings.sent2: The politician's pratfall cost him the election.
meanings.sent3: The CEO's pratfall in the business deal was a lesson in humility.
meanings.sent4: Her pratfall in front of the whole class felt like a spotlight on her mistake.
meanings.sent5: The team's pratfall in the championship game was a disappointing end to the season.
